chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Therefore, those guilty of repeated baptism should quickly return to the Church and seek God's forgiveness with tears and alms for such a great sin. Additionally, if anyone has denied the sacrament of the Catholic faith for rewards or out of fear of punishments and has joined heretics, they should reclaim the faith they denied and return to the Church swiftly, so that when Jesus comes, they can be found within the house outside of which no one can be saved. Just as in Jericho, anyone outside that house could not receive any means of life, so outside the Catholic Church, no one will receive forgiveness of sins.

Within the Catholic Church, one believes with the heart leading to righteousness and confesses with the mouth leading to salvation. Romans 10:10 Outside that same Church, wrong belief is counted for punishment, and wrong confession does not grant salvation but brings death. Outside this Church, the name Christian does not help anyone, baptism does not save, a pure sacrifice is not offered to God, forgiveness of sins is not received, and the happiness of eternal life is not found.

There is one Church of Christ, one dove, one beloved, one bride, in which the Trinity is believed to be one God of one nature and substance. In this Church, neither the Son nor the Holy Spirit is subjected to diminishment. The same worship and honor are given to the one Trinity, which is the true God.

This is the one true Church, which believes and proclaims the one essence of the Trinity, not preferring any one person over the others. Thus, it worships nothing different in the substance of divinity, confessing the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit, that is, the Trinity itself, as one true and only God. It avoids the error of Sabellian confusion in the name of unity and the deadly danger of Arian diversity in the term Trinity.
chunks.original_latin:
Proinde non solum quos iterati baptismi tenet reatus
innexos debent celeriter ad Ecclesiam recurrere,
et Deum lacrymis ac eleemosynis pro tanto scelere
deprecari; verum etiam si qui forsitan sine iteratione
baptismatis delectatione munerum seu timore poenarum
 negantes catholicae fidei sacramentum, ad haereticorum
sunt mortiferum dilapsi consortium, resumant
fidem quam negaverunt, et ad Ecclesiam celeriter
revertantur, ut Jesu veniente, intra illam domum
possint inveniri extra quam nullus potest ab
interitu liberari: quia sicut in Hiericho quisquis
extra illam domum fuit nullum potuit adipisci vitae
subsidium, sic extra Ecclesiam catholicam nullus
accipiet indulgentiam peccatorum; et sicut intra Ecclesiam
catholicam corde creditur ad justitiam, ore
autem confessio fit ad salutem (Rom X 10), sic extra
eamdem Ecclesiam mala credulitas non reputatur ad
justitiam, sed ad poenam, et prava confessio non ac
quirit salutem confitenti, sed ingerit mortem. Extra
hanc Ecclesiam nec Christianum nomen aliquem
 juvat, nec baptismus salvat, nec mundum Deo sacrificium
offertur, nec peccatorum remissio accipitur,
nec aeternae vitae felicitas invenitur. Una est enim
Christi Ecclesia, una columba, una dilecta, una
sponsa: in qua Trinitas unus Deus, unius naturae
atque substantiae creditur; in qua nec Filio, nec
Spiritui sancto contumelia minorationis ingeritur;
in qua unus atque idem cultus, et honor
unus uni Trinitati, quae Deus verus est, exhibetur. Haec est una vera 378 Ecclesia, quae sic credit et
praedicat unam Trinitatis essentiam, ut in tribus unam
quamlibet non audeat alteri praeferre personam. Sic
enim nihil se diversum colere in substantia divinitatis
ostendit, ut Patrem et Filium, et Spiritum sanctum,
hoc est ipsam Trinitatem unum verum et solum confitens
 Deum, nec in unitatis nomine Sabellianae confusionis
incurrat errorem, et in Trinitatis vocabulo
meminerit Arianae diversitatis mortiferam vitare perniciem.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak> 
    Just as apostolic preaching acknowledges the Trinity in the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit, it also upholds the true faith in one God. <break time="500ms"/> This is because it emphasizes the natural unity within the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. 
</speak>
chunks.original_latin:
Apostolicae quippe praedicationis retinens
normam, quemadmodum Trinitatem cognoscit in
personis Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus sancti; sic unius
Dei rectam praedicat fidem, quia in Patre, et Filio,
et Spiritu sancto naturalem praedicat unitatem.
